title: EUR/USD holds above key 1.1500 support – BBH
summary: EUR/USD remains above 1.1500 as Eurozone economic activity shows resilience and the ECB is expected to stay on hold, limiting downside against a still-restrictive Fed, BBH FX analysts report.

title: USD: Dollar Index holds above 200-DMA – MUFG
summary: The major foreign exchange rates have remained relatively stable overnight at the start of the holiday shortened week with Thanksgiving falling on Thursday, MUFG's FX analyst Lee Hardman reports.

title: EUR/JPY advances on Yen weakness driven by fiscal risks, low rate outlook
summary: EUR/JPY trades around 180.70, up 0.35% on Monday at the time of writing. The cross benefits from renewed selling pressure on the Japanese Yen (JPY), weakened by persistent concerns over Japan’s fiscal trajectory and doubts over an imminent rate hike by the Bank of Japan (BoJ).

title: USD consolidates as risk assets extend Friday bounce – BBH
summary: The US Dollar (USD) consolidates after last week’s gains as New York Fed President John Williams’ dovish remarks raise bets on a December rate cut, supporting equities and stabilizing bonds, BBH FX analysts report, BBH FX analysts report.

title: EUR/USD appreciates further as the Dollar dips in risk appetite
summary: EUR/USD is trimming losses on Monday, following a sharp decline last week. The pair is trading near 1.1540 after bouncing at 1.1490 on Friday, favoured by a moderate risk appetite in an otherwise calm start of the week.

title: GBP/JPY steadies above 205.00 with all eyes on UK budget
summary: The Pound has ticked up from Friday’s lows at 204.30, but it is struggling to find significant acceptance above the 205.00 level on Monday, despite the positive risk sentiment.

title: GBP: Holding steady into the budget – ING
summary: EUR/GBP is holding support near 0.8760–0.8770 ahead of the UK budget, with sterling’s upside constrained and some downside risk if the 2026 BoE easing cycle is under-priced, ING's FX analyst Chris Turner notes.

title: Oil: Brent slips to month-low amid Russia-Ukraine peace talks – ING
summary: Oil prices ended last week on a weak footing, with ICE Brent down more than 2.8%. This downward pressure continued in early morning today, with Brent trading at its lowest level in over a month. Ongoing talks to reach a Russia-Ukraine peace deal are weighing on the market.

title: USD/JPY pulls back as intervention rhetoric rises – OCBC
summary: The recent rise in USD/JPY is slowing with the pair falling on Friday. Intervention rhetoric is getting louder and more frequent. Pair was last seen at 156.76 levels.

title: JPY near lows as intervention risks rise – MUFG
summary: The Japanese Yen (JPY) has continued to trade close to recent lows at the start of the week after USD/JPY hit a high last week of 157.89. The pair has risen by around 10 big figures since Sanae Takaichi won the LDP leadership election.

title: EUR/CHF rebounds after holding 0.9210 support – Société Générale
summary: EUR/CHF is rebounding strongly after testing key support, with the pair now challenging a major trend line that could unlock further upside, Société Générale's FX analysts note.

title: EUR: Lower energy costs lift euro’s terms of trade to yearly high – ING
summary: European natural gas prices have fallen below EUR 30/MWh for the first time since May, boosting Europe’s terms of trade and offering relief to its struggling manufacturing sector, ING's FX analyst Chris Turner notes.

title: Brent struggles below 200-day average after September weakness – Société Générale
summary: Brent crude is stabilizing after last month’s trough near $60, but a break above key resistance is needed to confirm a sustained rebound, Société Générale's FX analysts note.

title: DXY: Noise from Fedspeaks might diminish – OCBC
summary: US Dollar (USD) continued to trade near recent highs, in response to Dec meeting expectations which had remain fluid. More data is coming in while comments from Fed officials continue to paint a divergence in opinions.

title: German IFO Business Climate Index declines to 88.1 in November vs. 88.5 expected
summary: German business morale deteriorated slightly in November, with the IFO Institute's Business Climate Index declining to 88.1 in November from 88.4 in October. This reading came in below the market expectation of 88.5.

title: USD/CAD flatlines around 1.4100 with the Greenback losing momentum
summary: The US Dollar is trading flat, around the 1.4100 level against the Canadian Dollar, after failing to break above 1.4130 on Friday.

title: WTI falls near $57.50 as US-Russia-Ukraine peace talks progress
summary: West Texas Intermediate (WTI) Oil price extends its losing streak for the fourth successive session, trading around $57.70 per barrel during the European hours on Monday.

title: Gold bounces off daily low as reviving Fed rate cut bets undermine USD
summary: Gold (XAU/USD) recovers slightly from the daily low touched during the early part of the European session and trades with a mild negative bias, just above the $4,060 level, down less than 0.15% for the day.

title: India Gold price today: Gold falls, according to FXStreet data
summary: Gold prices fell in India on Monday, according to data compiled by FXStreet.

title: NZD/USD slips near 0.5600 due to dovish RBNZ outlook
summary: NZD/USD loses ground after registering modest gains in the previous session, trading around 0.5610 during the European hours on Monday. The pair depreciates as the New Zealand Dollar struggles on dovish sentiment surrounding the Reserve Bank of New Zealand (RBNZ) policy outlook.

title: NZD/USD Price Forecasts: First signs of exhaustion below 0.5600
summary: The New Zealand Dollar is struggling to find acceptance above 0.5600 on Monday, after bouncing from multi-month lows at 0.5570. The pair maintains its broader bearish trend intact, amid hopes of further RBNZ easing later this week.

title: USD/CAD Price Forecast: Trades around 1.4100 due to bullish bias
summary: USD/CAD recovers its recent losses from the previous session, trading around 1.4100 during the early European hours on Monday. The daily chart’s technical setup reflects a persistent bullish bias, with the pair remaining within its ascending channel pattern.

title: Forex Today: Risk mood improves to start new week
summary: Here is what you need to know on Monday, November 24:

title: Crude Oil price today: WTI price bullish at European opening
summary: West Texas Intermediate (WTI) Oil price advances on Monday, early in the European session. WTI trades at $58.13 per barrel, up from Friday’s close at $57.90.Brent Oil Exchange Rate (Brent crude) is stable, hovering around its previous daily close at $61.90.

title: EUR/GBP posts modest gains near 0.8800 on weak UK Retail Sales
summary: The EUR/GBP cross trades with mild gains near 0.8790 during the early European trading hours on Monday. A softer-than-expected UK Retail Sales report for October weighs on the Pound Sterling (GBP) against the Euro (EUR). Germany’s November IFO Business Survey data will be published later on Monday.

title: Australian Dollar steady as US Dollar weakens on Fed rate cut bets
summary: The Australian Dollar (AUD) holds ground against the US Dollar (USD) on Monday ahead of the looming key inflation update this week.

title: Japanese Yen remains on the back foot against a softer USD; upside potential seems limited
summary: The Japanese Yen (JPY) recovers slightly against a mildly softer US Dollar (USD), though sticks to a negative bias through the Asian session on Monday amid concerns about Japan's ailing fiscal position.

title: GBP/USD Price Forecast: Looks to build on move beyond 1.3100; not out of the woods yet
summary: The GBP/USD pair reverses a modest Asian session dip and climbs back above the 1.3100 mark in the last hour amid a modest US Dollar (USD) downtick on Monday.

title: EUR/CAD gains near 1.6250 on cautious ECB policy outlook
summary: EUR/CAD gains ground after registering losses in the previous session, trading around 1.6240 during the Asian hours on Monday. The pair appreciates as the Euro (EUR) receives support from the cautious sentiment surrounding the European Central Bank’s (ECB) monetary policy outlook.

title: EUR/USD strengthens above 1.1500 as Fed rate cut bets grow
summary: The EUR/USD pair trades in positive territory around 1.1525 during the early European trading hours on Monday. The US Dollar (USD) edges lower against the Euro (EUR) as Federal Reserve (Fed) rate cut expectations rise.
